p: Interestingly, viral replication dynamics in PBMCs experimentally infected with CHIKV and DENV resulted in a significant reduction of CHIKV progeny and a moderate enhancement of DENV production. Co-infection also led to higher levels of IL-6 and TNFÎ±, implicated in the pathogenesis of the two arboviral diseases [ 152]. The effect of co-infections on CHIKV tropism and pathogenesis is ill-defined and should be further investigated both in humans and animal models.
